Key Match Events: Scotland's Michael Jones and George Munsey scored an unbeaten 45 and 41 respectively, taking their side to 90 without loss.
Mark Wood over-stepped by some margin, resulting in George Munsey surviving on 16 after initially being caught.
Michael Jones hit three consecutive boundaries off Chris Jordan, finishing the powerplay on 49 without loss.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland won the toss and chose to bat first.
Jos Buttler, England's captain, was delighted to have Jofra Archer back from injury.
This is the first T20I match between England and Scotland.
Scotland progressed undefeated through the Europe Region Qualifier.
Post-Match Reflections: The match was abandoned due to rain, leaving Scotland's 90 for 0 in vain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by multiple rain delays, eventually leading to its abandonment.
England were set an adjusted target of 109 from 10 overs on the DLS method.
There were reports of lightning around the venue, further delaying proceedings.
